date-allowed-dates.desc: You can specify allowed dates using arrays, objects, and functions.
date-allowed-dates.heading: ### Date pickers - Allowed dates

date-birthday.desc: Starting with year picker by default, resticting dates range and closing the picker menu after selecting the day make the perfect birthday picker.
date-birthday.heading: ### Date pickers - birthday picker

date-colorable.desc: Date picker colors can be set using the `color` and `header-color` props. If `header-color` prop is not provided header will use the `color` prop value.
date-colorable.heading: ### Date pickers - Colors

date-current.desc: By default the current date is displayed using outlined button - **show-current** prop allows you to remove the border or select different date to be displayed as the current one.
date-current.heading: ### Date pickers - current date indicator

date-dialog-and-menu.desc:
When integrating a picker into a `v-text-field`, it is recommended to use the **readonly** prop. This will prevent mobile keyboards from triggering. To save vertical space, you can also hide the picker title.  

  Pickers expose a slot that allow you to hook into save and cancel functionality. This will maintain an old value which can be replaced if the user cancels.
date-dialog-and-menu.heading: ### Date pickers - In dialog and menu

date-events.desc: You can specify events using arrays, objects or functions. To change the default color of the event use **event-color** prop. Your **events** function or object can return an array of colors (material or css) in case you want to display multiple event indicators.
date-events.heading: ### Date pickers - Events

date-formatting.desc: If you need to display date in the custom format (different than YYYY-MM-DD) you need to use the formatting function.
date-formatting.heading: ### Date pickers - formatting date

date-formatting-moment-datefns.desc: Formatting dates is possible also with external libs such as Moment.js or date-fns
date-formatting-moment-datefns.heading: ### Date pickers - formatting date using external libs

date-icons.desc: You can override the default icons used in the picker.
date-icons.heading: ### Date pickers - icons

date-internationalization.desc: The date picker supports internationalization through the JavaScript Date object. Specify a BCP 47 language tag using the `locale` prop, and then set the first day of the week with the `first-day-of-week` prop.
date-internationalization.heading: ### Date pickers - Internationalization

date-multiple.desc: Date picker can now select multiple dates with the `multiple` prop. If using `multiple` then date picker expects its model to be an array.
date-multiple.heading: ### Date pickers - Multiple

date-range.desc: Date picker can select date range with the `range` prop. When using `range` prop date picker expects its model to be an array of length 2 or empty.
date-range.heading: ### Date pickers - Range

date-picker-date.desc: You can watch the `pickerDate` which is the displayed month/year (depending on the picker type and active view) to perform some action when it changes.
date-picker-date.heading: ### Date pickers - react to displayed month/year change

date-readonly.desc: Selecting new date could be disabled by adding **readonly** prop.
date-readonly.heading: ### Date pickers - read only

date-width.desc: You can specify allowed the picker's width or make it full width.
date-width.heading: ### Date pickers - Setting picker width

month-allowed-months.desc: You can specify allowed months using arrays, objects or functions.
month-allowed-months.heading: ### Month pickers - Allowed months

month-colorable.desc: Month picker colors can be set using the `color` and `header-color` props. If `header-color` prop is not provided header will use the `color` prop value.
month-colorable.heading: ### Month pickers - Colors

month-current.desc: By default the current month is displayed using outlined button - **show-current** prop allows you to remove the border or select different month to be displayed as the current one.
month-current.heading: ### Month pickers - current month indicator

month-dialog-and-menu.desc:
When integrating a picker into a `v-text-field`, it is recommended to use the **readonly** prop. This will prevent mobile keyboards from triggering. To save vertical space, you can also hide the picker title. 

 Pickers expose a slot that allow you to hook into save and cancel functionality. This will maintain an old value which can be replaced if the user cancels.
month-dialog-and-menu.heading: ### Month pickers - In dialog and menu

month-events.desc: You can specify events using arrays, objects or functions. To change the default color of the event use **event-color** prop. Your **events** function or object can return an array of colors (material or css) in case you want to display multiple event indicators.
month-events.heading: ### Month pickers - Events

month-icons.desc: You can override the default icons used in the picker.
month-icons.heading: ### Month pickers - icons

month-internationalization.desc: The month picker supports internationalization through the JavaScript Date object. Specify a BCP 47 language tag using the `locale` prop, and then set the first day of the week with the `first-day-of-week` prop.
month-internationalization.heading: ### Month pickers - Internationalization

month-light.desc: Month pickers come in two orientation variations, portrait **(default)** and landscape.
month-light.heading: ### Month pickers

month-multiple.desc: Month pickers can now select multiple months with the `multiple` prop. If using `multiple` then the month picker expects its model to be an array.
month-multiple.heading: ### Month pickers - Multiple

month-readonly.desc: Selecting new date could be disabled by adding **readonly** prop.
month-readonly.heading: ### Month pickers - read only

month-width.desc: You can specify allowed the picker's width or make it full width.
month-width.heading: ### Month pickers - Setting picker width

usage.desc: Date pickers come in two orientation variations, portrait **(default)** and landscape. By default they are emitting `input` event when the day (for date picker) or month (for month picker), but with **reactive** prop they can update the model even after clicking year/month.

heading: # Date/month pickers
headingText: The `v-date-picker` is stand-alone component that can be utilized in many existing Vuetify components. It offers the user a visual representation for selecting date/month.

props.allowedDates: Restricts which dates can be selected
props.dayFormat: Allows you to customize the format of the day string that appears in the date table. Called with date (ISO 8601 string) arguments.
props.eventColor: Sets the color for event dot. It can be string (all events will have the same color) or `object` where attribute is the event date and value is boolean/color/array of colors for specified date or `function` taking date as a parameter and returning boolean/color/array of colors for that date
props.events: Array of dates or object defining events or colors or function returning boolean/color/array of colors
props.firstDayOfWeek: Sets the first day of the week, starting with 0 for Sunday.
props.headerDateFormat: Allows you to customize the format of the month string that appears in the header of the calendar. Called with date (ISO 8601 string) arguments.
props.locale: Sets the locale. Accepts a string with a BCP 47 language tag.
props.monthFormat: Formatting function used for displaying months in the months table. Called with date (ISO 8601 string) arguments.
props.multiple: Allow the selection of multiple dates
props.nextIcon: Sets the icon for next month/year button
props.prevIcon: Sets the icon for previous month/year button
props.range: Allow the selection of date range
props.reactive: Updates the picker model when changing months/years automatically
props.readonly: Makes the picker readonly (doesnt't allow to select new date)
props.scrollable: Allows changing displayed month with mouse scroll
props.selectedItemsText: Text used for translating the number of selected dates when using *multiple* prop. Can also be customizing globally in [Internationalization](/customization/internationalization).
props.showCurrent: Toggles visibility of the current date/month outline or shows the provided date/month as a current
props.showWeek: Toggles visibility of the week numbers in the body of the calendar
props.titleDateFormat: Allows you to customize the format of the date string that appears in the title of the date picker. Called with date (ISO 8601 string) arguments.
props.type: Determines the type of the picker - `date` for date picker, `month` for month picker
props.value: Date picker model (ISO 8601 format, YY-mm-dd or YY-mm)
props.weekdayFormat: Allows you to customize the format of the weekday string that appears in the body of the calendar. Called with date (ISO 8601 string) arguments.
props.yearFormat: Allows you to customize the format of the year string that appears in the header of the calendar. Called with date (ISO 8601 string) arguments.
props.yearIcon: Sets the icon in the year selection button

events.click:date: Emitted when the date button is clicked
events.dblclick:date: Emitted when the date button is double clicked
events.click:month: Emitted when the month button is clicked
events.dblclick:month: Emitted when the month button is double clicked. Usable only for `month` pickers.
events.change: Reactive date picker emits `input` even when any part of the date (year/month/day) changes, but `change` event is emitted only when the day (for date pickers) or month (for month pickers) changes. If `range` prop is set, date picker emits `change` when both [from, to] are selected.

slots.default: Displayed below the calendar, can be used for example for adding action button (`OK` and `Cancel`)
